Text: Arrive at the crystal quarry
Defeat the Lindblum zaghnal
Arrive at the Soul Center
Defeat Overseer Kanilokka
Arrive at the Dust Yoke
Defeat Lunipyati
My father must've come here for a reason...
That one looks mean. Be careful!
So the facility is still here...
What kind of research did they do here?
I have a bad feeling about this place...
Is that...a storm?
Something's wrong... Don't rush ahead!
Has that thing been here all this time!?
You... Surrender your souls...to King Zoraal Ja.
Come forth, my dear souls...
I won't let...precious samples escape...
Discard the flesh...extract the soul...
Why not serve a greater purpose...? The King of Resolve's purpose...
Relinquish your souls... For the glory of Alexandria!
More...more souls... The work demands more souls!
Would that we could tame the beast... But the seal is already...
What was that roar? Did it come from inside the storm!?
Search for rroneek
Stroke the trembling rroneek
Protect the rroneek
Defeat the tturuhhetso!
Attack the tturuhhetso's legs!
I've got it!
One well-placed piercing round to the chest, and...
You're done for!
Make haste! We must protect the rroneek.
Don't worry, we're right behind you.
There they are!
They're terrified. We must do what we can to soothe them.
That herd should be all right. Let's look for stragglers.
The rroneek are Turali too. None shall be left behind!
There must be something up ahead. Come!
These are no match for the likes of us!
“In a panic” was clearly an understatement.
More are coming!
You're mine!
All or nothing, then!
The hhetso! No...
It seems that did the trick.
You'll find the Vow of Reason is not without resolve!
Dammit! Not even a scratch!
Buy me some time to think, will you?
It must have a weakness...and I will find it!
Keep it busy! I need time!
Right. Go for the legs!
Get thinking, Koana!
A protective current of aether... But whence does it flow?
That stemmed the flow of protective aether.
There's nothing stopping us now!
Still not backing down, huh? Fine with me!
We must disperse that aether ere the reaver recovers it!
This is going to hurt...
I may have...overdone it a little...
\\<wheeze>...
For the fodder, at least. But where's...
Now we just have to keep it pinned...
Clear the First Training Objective
Clear the Second Training Objective
Clear the Third Training Objective
Clear the Fourth Training Objective
Speak with the Master of Trials
Clear All Challenge Objectives
Clear the First Challenge Objective
Clear the Second Challenge Objective
Clear the Third Challenge Objective
Clear the Fourth Challenge Objective
Bravo, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>!
Retake your starting position, and let's give it one more try!
Spectacular work! With that, your basic training is complete. Now, come and speak with me if you'd like to attempt my final challenge!
We will now begin the final challenge. Once you are prepared, take your starting position.
You'd like to start over? No problem at all! Go ahead and retake your starting position.
Your grasp of combat tactics is commendable indeed, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>.
Careful! You were on unsafe ground just now. You'll need to retry the objective.

Welcome, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. In this training exercise, we will have you carry out a variety of common evasive maneuvers.
My agent here will serve as your opponent. Try to get a sense for her oncoming attacks, and handle them accordingly.
Take your starting position when you are ready to begin.
As you doubtless know, no few magicks strike a wide radius around a given target. The marker of such an attack will often look like this...
If you sense that you've been marked, you'd do well to move away from your allies so that they aren't caught in the blast.
The danger is greater still if an ally is targeted at the same time. Stand too close to one another, and you will suffer double the impact!
Careful─you were too close to your ally just now. As you maneuver, you must be sure to mind each other's positions.
Our next exercise features a strike so powerful, it cannot be endured alone. Allow me to demonstrate its marker...
Should the enemy perform such an attack, you and your allies must stand together in order to weather it.
Upon sensing this marker, locate its target and make your way there as quick as you can!
Oh dear, you didn't reach your ally in time. Your absence was felt most painfully...
Next, we will look at a lethal variety of attack that none but a tank can handle. Behold its marker...
Remember, only the tank is equipped to survive a blow of this magnitude. Any other caught in its blast won't be left standing.
Now for a proper demonstration. Everyone, position yourselves so that the tank may shield against this strike alone!
Dear me, that must have hurt. Only the tank is equipped to endure such a brutal blow, all right? Let's try it again.
Next, let us practice how to handle a more persistent threat. Take note of this marker...
What will follow is a chain of attacks that chase you doggedly. You must stay on the move, all the while keeping away from your allies.
Remember, you must evade the barrage while leading it away from your allies!
Allow me to test all that you have learned thus far.
In this exercise, you will face a slew of different attacks, each of which you must deal with appropriately to minimize the harm you sustain.
Oh dear, a party member was caught in the attack. Remember to be mindful of your allies' positions.
Gods above! Not only did you hurt your poor ally, but you stood on unsafe ground as well!
Alas, you didn't reach your ally in time. A painful lesson...
Tsk-tsk. Not only did you fail to stand with your ally, you stood on unsafe ground as well!
Ye gods...that can't have been pleasant. Lest you forget, only the tank can withstand such lethal attacks.
Are you all right!? That attack wasn't meant for more than the tank─and on unsafe ground, no less!
Unfortunately, you failed to evade all of the attacks, and have thereby failed this objective.
It would seem the attack targeting you inadvertently struck a party member. You'll need to retry this objective.
You and your ally were both hit, I noticed. I'm afraid you have failed this objective.
Alas, you didn't pass the challenge. Retake your starting position, and let's give it one more try!
You handled every last threat with finesse. It is with pleasure that I declare you have passed the challenge!
Commencing in 3...
Let the exercise begin!
To start the next exercise, take your starting position.
Masterfully judged! You handled that flawlessly.
Precisely what I had hoped to see!
I'm pleased you took the lesson to heart.
Among you adventurers, I'm given to understand that these are known as “stack markers.” Rings odd to my ear, but I suppose it matters not.
These attacks pack quite a punch. Should it fall to you to deal with it, you'd do well to employ what abilities you have to lighten the damage.

Retake your starting position, and let's give it one more try!
Spectacular work! With that, your basic training is complete. Now, come and speak with me if you'd like to attempt my final challenge!
We will now begin the final challenge. Once you are prepared, take your starting position.
You'd like to start over? No problem at all! Go ahead and retake your starting position.
Your grasp of combat tactics is commendable indeed, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>.
Careful! You were on unsafe ground just now. You'll need to retry the objective.

Welcome, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. In this training exercise, we will have you carry out a medley of cutting-edge tactical maneuvers.
My agent here will serve as your opponent. Try to get a sense for her oncoming attacks, and handle them accordingly.
Take your starting position when you are ready to begin.
First, let's discuss knockback attacks. The marker will look like this...
As soon as you sense it, you will have but a few moments to position yourself before you are pushed a set distance from its point of impact.
For this exercise, I have placed a ring of lightning aether around the arena. Your goal is to position yourself such that you won't be sent hurtling into it!
Oh dear... That lightning must have given you quite the nasty jolt. Try to stand as close as you can to the point of impact!
While we're at it, let's review a common variant. Take note of this marker...
Unlike last time, I don't recommend you stand directly in the center of it, lest you receive a most painful blow to the skull.
And so, once more, I challenge you to avoid being flung into the lightning. Where will you stand this time?
Remember, the glowing ground is itself a potent attack, and thus unsafe to stand in. Let's have you retry this objective.
That lightning is rather unpleasant to the touch, isn't it? I suggest you stand at the very edge of the area of effect attack.
Next, we'll demonstrate a proximity attack. Its marker pulses outward, like so...
With these, the closer you are to its point of impact, the greater the damage you stand to take.
Thus, whenever you see that ominous light pulsing along the ground, I advise you to distance yourself as much as possible.
Too close to the point of impact! You want to keep your distance from these to minimize the damage.
Next, let's move on to tower tactics! This type of attack is one that must be endured rather than avoided.
See the tower marker? If no one stands inside to weaken its impact, the entire party will suffer a devastating blow.
Therefore, one person must volunteer to take the tower, shielding the rest of the party from far greater casualties.
And that is what happens when a tower is left unoccupied. Remember, this is a team effort!
Now let's cover a variant of the tower marker. Again, one of you will need to stand inside to protect the others.
Lest you forget, if the tower goes unoccupied, the entire party will pay the price.
In this case, you must ensure you are standing within the bounds of the circle before the arcane orb strikes the ground.
And that is what happens when a tower is left unoccupied. Remember, this is a team effort!
Allow me to test all that you have learned thus far.
In this exercise, you will face a slew of different attacks, each of which you must deal with appropriately to minimize the harm you sustain.
Oh dear, straight into the lightning... Try to stand a bit closer to the point of impact next time.
Poor thing. Not only were you knocked into the lightning, but you stood on unsafe ground as well.
Alas, you were too close to the proximity attack. Let's have you retry the objective.
By the gods... Not only did you take a nasty blow from the attack, but your empty tower inflicted catastrophic injury upon the rest of your party...
Lesson learned: an empty tower hurts. Whenever you see one, be not afraid to stand against the attack─your allies will thank you!
I'm afraid you stood too close to the proximity attack. You'll need to retry the objective.
Lesson learned: an empty tower hurts. Whenever you see one, be not afraid to stand against the attack─your allies will thank you!
Focus, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>! Not only did your tower go unoccupied, but you stood on unsafe ground as well!
Alas, you didn't pass the challenge. Retake your starting position, and let's give it one more try!
You handled every last threat with finesse. It is with pleasure that I declare you have passed the challenge!
Commencing in 3...
Let the exercise begin!
To start the next exercise, take your starting position.
Masterfully judged! You handled that flawlessly.
Precisely what I had hoped to see!
I'm pleased you took the lesson to heart.
Barely a scratch, eh? Sometimes the simplest solution is to get the hells out of there, so to speak.

Careful! You were on unsafe ground just now. You'll need to retry the objective.

Welcome, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. In this training exercise, we will have you carry out even more advanced tactical maneuvers.
My agent here will serve as your opponent. Try to get a sense for her oncoming attacks, and handle them accordingly.
Take your starting position when you are ready to begin.
For your first exercise, allow me to demonstrate the proximity tether. Its marker looks like this...
When entangled with one of these, to remain near the enemy is to risk suffering a painful strike.
Instead, use what precious few moments you have to retreat until the tether's magicks weaken!
You must move away until the tether visibly changes. Try again!
Before we move on, there is another type of tether attack I wish to cover. Take note of this marker...
Unlike proximity tethers, these can be intercepted at will, allowing you to sustain a blow on another's behalf.
